```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Package prep
require(tidyr)
require(dplyr)
require(tibble)
require(readr)
require(mosaic)
require(ggplot2)
require(reshape2)
require(leaps)
require(lubridate)

# Data prep
new_combined_2021 <- read_csv("https://www.dropbox.com/s/nolym5vik4je3yu/final_merged_data.csv?dl=1")
```

## Dividing the large dataset
```{r}
# Splitting the original data frame into halves
# half <- ncol(new_combined_2021) %/% 2 + 4
# new_combined_1 <- new_combined_2021[, c(1:4, 5:half)]
# new_combined_2 <- new_combined_2021[, c(1:4, (half+1):ncol(new_combined_2021))]
# View(new_combined_1)
# View(new_combined_2)

# Moving CFR to the fourth row
new_combined_2021 <- new_combined_2021 %>% 
  select(1:3, CFR, everything())

# Splitting into four smaller data frames
# Determine the number of splits and the size of each split
n <- ncol(new_combined_2021) - 4
k <- 4
cols_per_dataset <- ceiling(n / k)
datasets <- list()

for (i in seq_len(k)) {
  start_col <- (i - 1) * cols_per_dataset + 5
  end_col <- min(i * cols_per_dataset + 4, 
                 ncol(new_combined_2021))
  datasets[[i]] <- cbind(new_combined_2021[, 1:4], 
                         new_combined_2021[, start_col:end_col])
}

# Splitting the large list into four small ones
quarter_1 <- datasets[[1]]
quarter_2 <- datasets[[2]]
quarter_3 <- datasets[[3]]
quarter_4 <- datasets[[4]]
```

## Linear regression models
```{r}
fit_1 <- lm(CFR ~ ., data = quarter_1)
fit_2 <- lm(CFR ~ ., data = quarter_2)
fit_3 <- lm(CFR ~ ., data = quarter_3)
fit_4 <- lm(CFR ~ ., data = quarter_4)
```

## Stepwise regression models
```{r}
step_1 <- step(fit_1)
step_2 <- step(fit_2)
step_3 <- step(fit_3)
step_4 <- step(fit_4)
```

## Regression subsets
```{r}
bs_1 <- regsubsets(data = quarter_1, 
                          CFR ~ ., 
                          nbest = 1, 
                          nvmax = NULL, 
                          force.in = NULL, force.out = NULL, 
                          method = "exhaustive", 
                   really.big = T)

summary_bs_1 <- summary(bs_1)
as.data.frame(summary_bs_1$outmat)

numb_predictors <- which.max(summary_bs_1$adjr2)
summary_bs_1$which[numb_predictors,]

bs_2 <- regsubsets(data = quarter_2,
```
